SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
DATA PROTECTION AND PRIVACY
Satisfy Data Subject Access Requests

The Data Subject Access Request feature in Privacy Center addresses your customers’ right to obtain a copy of their personally identifiable information (PII).

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To use the Data Subject Access Requests feature:	ModifyAllData, ManageDsarPolicy, and ExecuteDsarPolicy
Requires the Salesforce Privacy Center add-on subscription.

Create a Portability Policy to identify relevant customer PII found in various objects and fields. Then use Portability API to compile the PII into a secure file that you can repackage and deliver to your customer. View the history and status of all requests in the Portability Log.

Alternatively, use the Privacy Request object to manage data requests. Build triggers and flows to receive and execute requests, and then share the results of the request response with the data subject. Incorporate the Privacy Request object into your reports and dashboards to gain insight into the data subject access requests that your org receives. For more information, see Privacy Request.

Create a Portability Policy
The policy detects and displays any default and custom objects connected to the Account, Contact, Individual, Lead, Person, or User objects. And you can select individual fields on an object that represent a customer’s personally identifiable information (PII).
Monitor Data Subject Access Request Fulfillment with the Portability Log
Make sure that you fulfill every customer request in Salesforce to access personal data in accordance with data compliance law. Use the Portability Log in Privacy Center to see a history of your executed portability policies. You can also access the files generated by Portability API to repackage and deliver the requested customer data.
